@description.name: @description
@description.body:
A list of items. Displays an automatically scrolling list for all
added {@link qx.ui.form.ListItem} instances. Supports various
selection options: single, multi, ...

@param.name: @param
@param.body: horizontal {Boolean?false} Whether the list should be horizontal.
@param.description: Whether the list should be horizontal.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the list should be rendered horizontal or vertical.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Spacing between the items

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Controls whether the inline-find feature is activated or not

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Class} Pointer to the selection manager to use

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handle child widget adds on the content pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handle child widget removes on the content pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Used to route external keypress events to the list handling (in fact the manager of the list)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This container holds the list item widgets.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.container.Composite} Container for the list item widgets
@return.desc: Container for the list item widgets

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event listener for keypress events.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handles the inline find - if enabled

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Takes the given string and tries to find a ListItem
which starts with this string. The search is not case sensitive and the
first found ListItem will be returned. If there could not be found any
qualifying list item, null will be returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: search {String} The text with which the label of the ListItem should start with
@param.description: The text with which the label of the ListItem should start with

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Find an item by its {@link qx.ui.basic.Atom#getLabel}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: search {String} A label or any item

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds the given item to the existing selection.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if the item is not a child element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Removes the given item from the selection.

Use {@link qx.ui.core.ISingleSelection#resetSelection} when you
want to clear the whole selection at once.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if the item is not a child element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns an array of currently selected items.

Note: The result is only a set of selected items, so the order can
differ from the sequence in which the items were added.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Replaces current selection with the given items.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if the item is not a child element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Detects whether the given item is currently selected.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if the item is not a child element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the selection is empty.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all elements which are selectable.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
all {Boolean} true for all selectables, false for the
selectables the user can interactively select
@param.description:
true for all selectables, false for the
selectables the user can interactively select

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the required state of a widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: required {Boolean} A flag signaling if the widget is required.
@param.description: A flag signaling if the widget is required.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the current required state of the widget.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} True, if the widget is required.
@return.desc: True, if the widget is required.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the valid state of the widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: valid {Boolean} The valid state of the widget.
@param.description: The valid state of the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the valid state of the widget.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} If the state of the widget is valid.
@return.desc: If the state of the widget is valid.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the invalid message of the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the invalid message of the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the invalid message if required of the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the invalid message if required of the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the field model value. Should also update the UI.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var|null} Updates the field with the new model value.
@param.description: Updates the field with the new model value.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{null|Error} Should return an error when the type of
model value is not compatible with the implementing class (the concrete field).
@return.desc:
Should return an error when the type of
model value is not compatible with the implementing class (the concrete field).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a consistent and up-to-date model value. Note: returned value can also be a promise of type Promise<*|null>.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var|null} The model value plain or as promise.
@return.desc: The model value plain or as promise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Tries to set the selection using the given array containing the
representative models for the selectables.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of the selected models.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array containing the models of the currently selected
items.
@return.desc:
An array containing the models of the currently selected
items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Forward the call with the given function name to the children container

@param.name: @param
@param.body: functionName {String} name of the method to forward
@param.description: name of the method to forward

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a1 {var} first argument of the method to call
@param.description: first argument of the method to call

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a2 {var} second argument of the method to call
@param.description: second argument of the method to call

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a3 {var} third argument of the method to call
@param.description: third argument of the method to call

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The return value of the forward method
@return.desc: The return value of the forward method

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the children list

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{LayoutItem[]} The children array (Arrays are
reference types, please do not modify them in-place)
@return.desc:
The children array (Arrays are
reference types, please do not modify them in-place)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget contains children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Returns true when the widget has children.
@return.desc: Returns true when the widget has children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Adds a new child widget.

The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager
used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class
documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove the given child item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove all children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array} An array containing the removed children.
@return.desc: An array containing the removed children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index position of the given item if it is a child item. Otherwise it returns -1. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {LayoutItem} the item to query for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.
@return.desc: The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add a child at the specified index

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index, at which the item will be inserted
@param.description: Index, at which the item will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add an item before another already inserted item

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: before {LayoutItem} item before the new item will be inserted.
@param.description: item before the new item will be inserted.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add an item after another already inserted item

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: after {LayoutItem} item, after which the new item will be inserted
@param.description: item, after which the new item will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Remove the item at the specified index.

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index of the item to remove.
@param.description: Index of the item to remove.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects an item range between two given items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns an array of currently selected items sorted
by their index in the container.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the last selection context.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the internal selection manager. Use this with
caution!

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the current lead item. Generally the item which was last modified
by the user (tapped on etc.)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event listener for changeSelection event on selection manager.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Locale change event handler
